title: Owen Wilson Takes The Colbert Questionert - Part One

rawLines.text: [Applause]
[Music]
Hey, welcome back everybody. Ladies and
gentlemen, you know my first guest
tonight from Midnight in Paris, the
Royal Tenon Bombs and Zoolander. He now
stars in the Apple TV Plus show Stick.
Please welcome Owen Wilson.
[Applause]
[Music]
[Applause]
There you go.
Hey, that's really nice.
Yeah. So nice to have you on.
Thank you for having me. you know, it's
it's you know, I I wanted to talk to you
for for a long time. I've been a fan
since, you know, I guess since Bottle
Rocket, you know, since since back in
the day.
That was the beginning.
Yeah. Yeah. And, you know, I just
thought that after, you know, after so
many years I wanted to talk to you, I
could we could just go into some old
normal interview right now, right?
You know, talk about stick, you know,
but uh you know, uh I think that because
I I it's been so long since I've I've
had a had chance to talk to you. I've
wanted to for so long that I thought
maybe we just try to go straight to the
heart of Owen Wilson.
Yeah. Are you are are you we have this
thing on the show. It's called the Col
Bear questionnaire.
Okay.
And I was wondering
are you familiar? Have you heard of it?
Yeah.
Have you heard of it? Your friends out
in Hollywood have told you about the
questionnaire.
Y has made it west.
Okay. Good. Good. It's take it takes a
fair amount of courage because these are
all ergonomically designed to penetrate
straight to your soul and reveal you to
an audience. And you have the courage to
be known.
It's about time. Let's let's figure out
what makes this guy click.
Okay. Fantastic. Well, uh, brave man.
So, what's going to happen right now,
ladies and gentlemen? This is the cold
bear questionnaire with Owen Wilson.
Here we go.
All right. You want to hydrate or

um That's you. Yeah. Okay.
It is important.
Owen Wilson, first question of the
questionnaire.
Easy,
sir. We'll ease you in. Okay.
What is the best sandwich?
Well, um,
of course the little kid in you wants to
find a loophole and say an ice cream
sandwich, but uh,
you'll accept any answer. I think I I
think what I would say is um you know
when we would visit my grandmother and
go to the beach, she would make PB&Js
with the crust cut off uh on Pepperage
Farm bread and uh like bread like the
Yeah, the thin the sandwich bread and
then having that, you know, nothing
works up an appetite like swimming in
the ocean. So that was very satisfying.
You get the salty and you get the sweet
at the same time.
And then I had a great grandmother, too.
Yeah. What What jelly are we talking
about here?
Uh I think it was Smuckers.
Yeah. Strawberry.
Strawberry. Great. Yeah. And with a name
like Smuckers.
Yeah.
It's got to be good.
It's got to be good. Thank you. Are they
a sponsor?
Cut that out right now then. All right.
Uh oh. Uh Owen Wilson, what was the
first concert you attended? the uh it
was the Rolling Stones
1980, so I was 12 and it was the Tattoo
U tour. And that's where Mick Jagger was
wearing uh kind of like football pants
like with no pads and a very tight like
very tight yellow. These were yellow
kind of canary yellow
and um you know and the day before it
had been just a downpour. And so the the
day that I went, uh, they were really
happy. There was no rain and it was a
beautiful, I mean, it was just kind of
overwhelming, you know, for a
12-year-old. Uh, but
you have a favorite Stone song? It's not
on the question. What's your favorite
song?
Uh, my favorite Stone song
or anything you remember from that
concert?
Yeah. Uh, well, I mean, Start Me Up,
that was the big
Yeah. That was the big hit. But, uh, my
favorite uh, I think I would have to say
Tumbling Dice. Uh, okay. Or maybe the
Keith Richards one. Uh, happy that he
said.
Oh, yeah. Yeah. My Keith is uh Before
They Make Me Run.
Oh, I was going I was about just about
to say that.
I took it. It's too late.
Really?
Yeah.
What is the scariest animal?
Scariest animal? Um,
I don't love rats.
I I would have to say Yeah, I would have
to say rats.
Rats. Uh, apples or oranges?
Well, you can't really compare them, can
you?
Oh, you just have to choose.
Yes. Um, I would choose for me um I I
would say apple. Like a good like
crunchy apple. Uh, well, you know, for
an apple pie, you kind of need the green
ones, Granny Smith. But for just an
apple, I would go for just the classic
red fall apple that you
like a Macintosh.
Uh, yeah. Yeah. Or like a red delicious.
Yeah. Keep going. Keep going.
Gala.
Yes.
Honey crisp.
Fuji crisp.
Honey. Gosh.
Yeah. Cosmic crisp.
Yeah.
Yeah. Yeah. A couple of those. The Honey
Crisp.
Yeah. I'm a Fuji man. I'm a Fuji man.
Okay.
Have you ever asked someone for their
autograph?
I have. Lots. But uh the one I remember
as a kid when I was maybe um maybe in
college in Dallas was Oliver Stone was
in Dallas filming and I saw him and I
went up and I said I'd like to get an
autograph for my brother Luke and he
called his wife over and he said, "This
is for Luke." He goes, "That's a real
Texas name, isn't it?" And so I felt
like I had a real sort of moment with
them. So it was more than just an
autograph. I had that thing where he
brought his wife over to uh compliment
or I took it as a compliment. So did
Luke. That's a real
text. Yeah. Did he say anything about
Owen?
No, cuz I didn't that didn't come up. Uh
I didn't ever say my name.
What uh what do you think happens when
we die?
Whoa.
Yeah, we don't pull our punches here.
Question. Um,
I think that you hear a voice
and I think that voice sounds a lot like
Jim Nance.
And I think that voice says, "And now,
welcome to the first tea from Dallas,
Texas, Owen Wilson."
And the angels go bananas.
Wow.
And that for And the fir the first And
the first the first hole in heaven.
Yeah.
Par four.
Par five. Part three.
Dog leg. Par five.
Dog leg. Right. Left. There you go.
Okay. We have to take a quick break, but
when we come back, Owen Wilson will
complete the Colbear questionnaire.
Stick around everybody.
[Applause]
[Music]
Yeah.
